nano.remexp
Class ThreadHandler

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.ThreadHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientSocketAcceptor, NanoSocket, NanoSocketObserver, RemExpSocketAcceptor, RemoteExperimentMonitor, SocketConnector, StreamPipe
public abstract class ThreadHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The ThreadHandler wrapper lets us control and observe all threads. It gives them also a certain standard behaviour.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Constructor Detail

ThreadHandler

public ThreadHandler()
Method Detail

start

public void start(java.lang.String name)
Calling this method will start a thread that runs for this object.

Parameters:
name - the name of the thread that helps to determine it later.

run

public void run()
The run method of the threads. They call the abstract method doTask while the thread is supposed to be running. After stopThread is called on this object the while loop is exited and the abstract method shutDown is called. Attention: the object might be locked in the doTask method and thus won't exit. Thus it might be necessary to call the shutDown method directly on the object.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

stopThread

public void stopThread()
This method stops the thread softly, meaning it will not continue to run after the next time the doTask method is completed.

isAliveThread

public boolean isAliveThread()
Checks whether this object has received the stopThread command already. Normally this only returns false if the stopThread method has been called. It is possible the thread has been stopped but is still in or locked in the doTask method. Use the @see didExitRunMethod function to check whether the thread really stopped by now.

Returns:
true if the thread is still ALLOWED to run, else false.

didExitRunMethod

public boolean didExitRunMethod()
Returns information about whether the thread ended the run method and thus died.

Returns:
true if the thread dies, else false.

getThreadName

public java.lang.String getThreadName()
Returns the name of this thread.

Returns:
the name of this thread

doTask

public abstract void doTask()
The abstract method that is being repeated during lifetime of the thread.

shutDown

public abstract void shutDown()
Important! every implementation of the shutDown method has to call stopThread in order to be sure the thread is being shut down! (or otherwise set thisThread=null) Else the doTask method will be called over and over again and the thread won't die.
